<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The weighted-average amortization period for the identifiable intangible assets shown above is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years. Customer relationships and customer contracts represent the fair values of the underlying relationships and agreements with Studer Group customers. The trade name represents the fair value of the brand and name recognition associated with the marketing of Studer Group&#8217;s service offerings. Technology and software and publishing content represent the estimated fair values of Studer Group&#8217;s software and books that are sold to customers. Goodwill is recognized for the excess of purchase price over the net fair value of assets acquired and liabilities assumed, and largely reflects
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	16
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#HURN2016123110-K_HTM_S42B1F11A3BAC561DA7E5A3C09D5506F0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	HURON CONSULTING GROUP INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Tabular amounts in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the expanded market opportunities expected from combining the service offerings of Huron and Studer Group, as well as the assembled workforce of Studer Group. Goodwill recognized in conjunction with the acquisition of Studer Group was recorded in the Healthcare segment. Goodwill of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$119.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is expected to be deductible for income tax purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Studer Group&#8217;s results of operations have been included in our consolidated statements of earnings and other comprehensive income and results of operations of our Healthcare segment from the date of acquisition. For the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, revenues from Studer Group were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$79.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and operating income was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$21.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of amortization expense for intangible assets acquired. In connection with the acquisition of Studer Group, we incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of transaction and acquisition-related expenses,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of which were incurred in 2014, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of which were incurred in 2015. These costs are recorded in selling, general and administrative expenses in the period in which they were incurred.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following unaudited supplemental pro forma information summarizes the combined results of operations for Huron and Studer Group for the twelve months ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 as though the companies were combined on January&#160;1, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The historical financial information has been adjusted to give effect to pro forma adjustments, which consist of intangible assets amortization expense, acquisition-related costs, interest expense, the related income tax effects, and shares issued as consideration. These adjustments are based upon currently available information and certain assumptions. Therefore, the pro forma consolidated results are not necessarily indicative of what the Company&#8217;s consolidated results of operations actually would have been had it completed the acquisition on January&#160;1, 2014. The historical results included in the pro forma consolidated results do not purport to project future results of operations of the combined companies, nor do they reflect the expected realization of any cost savings or revenue synergies associated with the acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Sky Analytics, Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Effective January 1, 2015, we completed the acquisition of Sky Analytics, Inc. ("Sky Analytics"), a Massachusetts-based provider of legal spend management software for corporate law departments. Sky Analytics' results of operations have been included in the results of operations of our Huron Legal segment from the date of acquisition, and classified as discontinued operations upon the sale of the Huron Legal segment in the fourth quarter of 2015. Refer to Note 3 "Discontinued Operations" for additional detail on the sale of the Huron Legal segment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Rittman Mead India
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Effective July 1, 2015, we completed the acquisition of Rittman Mead Consulting Private Limited ("Rittman Mead India"), the India affiliate of Rittman Mead Consulting Ltd. Rittman Mead India is a data and analytics consulting firm that specializes in the implementation of enterprise performance management and analytics systems. Rittman Mead India's results of operations have been included in our consolidated financial statements and results of operations of our Business Advisory segment from the date of acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cloud62, Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Effective October 1, 2015, we completed the acquisition of Cloud62, Inc. ("Cloud62"), a New York-based consulting firm specializing in Salesforce.com implementations and related cloud-based applications. Cloud62's results of operations have been included in our consolidated financial statements and results of operations of our Business Advisory segment from the date of acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The acquisitions of Sky Analytics, Rittman Mead India, and Cloud62 were not significant to our consolidated financial statements individually or in the aggregate as of and for the twelve months ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

	The Frankel Group Associates LLC
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	During the first quarter of 2014, we completed the acquisition of The Frankel Group Associates LLC ("Frankel Group"), a New York-based life sciences consulting firm. Frankel Group's results of operations have been included in our consolidated financial statements and results of operations of our Education and Life Sciences segment from the date of acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>

	During the second quarter of 2014, we completed the acquisition of Vonlay, LLC ("Vonlay"), a healthcare technology consulting firm. Vonlay's results of operations have been included in our consolidated financial statements and results of operations of our Healthcare segment from the date of acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During the fourth quarter of 2014, we completed the acquisition of Threshold Consulting, Inc. ("Threshold"), a provider of cloud-based software as a service applications, data warehousing, and business intelligence solutions, as well as customer relationship management consulting services. Threshold's results of operations have been included in our consolidated financial statements and results of operations of our Business Advisory segment from the date of acquisition.
</FONT>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Refer to Note 4 "Acquisitions" for additional information on the goodwill recorded in connection with business combinations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2016 Annual Goodwill Impairment Test
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Pursuant to our policy, we performed our annual goodwill impairment test as of November&#160;30,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on our four reporting units with goodwill balances: Healthcare, Education and Life Sciences, Business Advisory, and Enterprise Solutions and Analytics. Our All Other reporting unit does not have a goodwill balance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For each reporting unit, we reviewed goodwill for impairment utilizing the quantitative two-step process. We performed the first step of the quantitative two-step impairment test by comparing the fair value of each reporting unit to its respective carrying amount, including goodwill.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Based on the results of the first step of the goodwill impairment test, we determined that the fair values of each of the Healthcare, Education and Life Sciences, Business Advisory, and Enterprise Solutions and Analytics reporting units exceeded its carrying value by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	11%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	96%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	116%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	11%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. Further, we evaluated whether any events have occurred or any circumstances have changed since November&#160;30, 2016 that would indicate goodwill may have become impaired since our annual impairment test. Based on our evaluation as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we determined that no indications of impairment have arisen since our annual goodwill impairment test. The results of an impairment analysis are as of a point in time. There is no assurance that the actual future earnings or cash flows of our reporting units will be consistent with our projections. We will monitor any changes to our assumptions and will evaluate goodwill as deemed warranted during future periods. Any significant decline in our operations could result in non-cash goodwill impairment charges.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	19
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Identifiable intangible assets with finite lives are amortized over their estimated useful lives. Customer relationships and customer contracts, as well as certain trade names and technology and software, are amortized on an accelerated basis to correspond to the cash flows expected to be derived from the assets. All other intangible assets with finite lives are amortized on a straight-line basis. In connection with the acquisition of MyRounding, we acquired in-process technology which is accounted for as an indefinite-lived intangible asset until the development of the technology is complete, which occurred in the first quarter of 2017. Accordingly, we will amortize the asset beginning in the first quarter of 2017 over a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year useful life on a straight-line basis. Refer to Note 4 "Acquisitions" for additional information on the acquisition of MyRounding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Intangible assets amortization expense was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$33.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$28.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$8.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. The table below sets forth the estimated annual amortization expense for each of the five succeeding years for the definite-lived intangible assets recorded as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	6. Property and Equipment, Net
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Depreciation expense for property and equipment was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$12.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$12.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. Property and equipment, net at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Convertible Notes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In September 2014, the Company issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$250 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;principal amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;convertible senior notes due 2019 (the &#8220;Convertible Notes&#8221;) in a private offering. The Convertible Notes are governed by the terms of an indenture between the Company and U.S. Bank National Association, as Trustee (the &#8220;Indenture&#8221;). The Convertible Notes are senior unsecured obligations of the Company and will pay interest semi-annually on April&#160;1 and October&#160;1 of each year at an annual rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Convertible Notes will mature on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	October&#160;1, 2019
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, unless earlier repurchased by the Company or converted in accordance with their terms.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Upon conversion, the Convertible Notes will be settled, at our election, in cash, shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock, or a combination of cash and shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock. Our current intent and policy is to settle conversions with a combination of cash and shares of common stock with the principal amount of the Convertible Notes paid in cash, in accordance with the settlement provisions of the Indenture.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The initial conversion rate for the Convertible Notes is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	12.5170
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock per
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;principal amount of the Convertible Notes, which is equal to an initial conversion price of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$79.89
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share of our common stock. The conversion rate will be subject to adjustment upon the occurrence of certain specified events but will not be adjusted for accrued and unpaid interest, except in certain limited circumstances described in the Indenture. Upon the occurrence of a &#8220;make-whole fundamental change&#8221; (as defined in the Indenture) the Company will, in certain circumstances, increase the conversion rate by a number of additional shares for a holder that elects to convert its Convertible Notes in connection with such make-whole fundamental change. Additionally, if the Company undergoes a &#8220;fundamental change&#8221; (as defined in the Indenture), a holder will have the option to require the Company to repurchase all or a portion of its Convertible Notes for cash at a price equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the principal amount of the Convertible Notes being repurchased plus any accrued
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	21
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#HURN2016123110-K_HTM_S42B1F11A3BAC561DA7E5A3C09D5506F0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	HURON CONSULTING GROUP INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Tabular amounts in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and unpaid interest. As discussed below, the convertible note hedge transactions and warrants, which were entered into in connection with the Convertible Notes, effectively raise the price at which economic dilution would occur from the initial conversion price of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$79.89
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$97.12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Holders of the Convertible Notes may convert their Convertible Notes at their option at any time prior to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	July&#160;1, 2019
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, only under the following circumstances:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:60PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	during any calendar quarter (and only during such calendar quarter) commencing after December&#160;31, 2014 if, for each of at least
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;trading days (whether or not consecutive) during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;consecutive trading day period ending on, and including, the last trading day of the immediately preceding calendar quarter, the last reported sale price of the Company&#8217;s common stock for such trading day is equal to or greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	130%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the applicable conversion price on such trading day;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:60PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	during the five consecutive business day period immediately following any five consecutive trading day period (such five consecutive trading day period, the &#8220;measurement period&#8221;) in which, for each trading day of the measurement period, the &#8220;trading price&#8221; (as defined in the Indenture) per
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;principal amount of the Convertible Notes for such trading day was less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	98%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the product of the last reported sale price of the Company&#8217;s common stock for such trading day and the applicable conversion rate on such trading day; or
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:60PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	upon the occurrence of specified corporate transactions described in the Indenture.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On or after July&#160;1, 2019 until the close of business on the second scheduled trading day immediately preceding the maturity date, a holder may convert all or a portion of its Convertible Notes, regardless of the foregoing circumstances.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have separated the Convertible Notes into liability and equity components. The carrying amount of the liability component was determined by measuring the fair value of a similar liability that does not have an associated convertible feature, assuming our non-convertible debt borrowing rate. The carrying value of the equity component representing the conversion option, which is recognized as a debt discount, was determined by deducting the fair value of the liability component from the proceeds of the Convertible Notes. The debt discount is amortized to interest expense using an effective interest rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.751%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;over the term of the Convertible Notes. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the remaining life of the Convertible Notes is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years. The equity component will not be remeasured as long as it continues to meet the conditions for equity classification.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The transaction costs related to the issuance of the Convertible Notes were separated into liability and equity components based on their relative values, as determined above. Transaction costs attributable to the liability component are recorded as a deduction to the carrying amount of the liability and amortized to interest expense over the term of the Convertible Notes; and transaction costs attributable to the equity component are netted with the equity component of the Convertible Notes in stockholders&#8217; equity. Total debt issuance costs were approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$7.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was allocated to liability issuance costs and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was allocated to equity issuance costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Convertible Notes consisted of the following:&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

	(3,415

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the issuance of the Convertible Notes, we entered into convertible note hedge transactions and warrant transactions. The convertible note hedge transactions are intended to reduce the potential future economic dilution associated with the conversion of the Convertible Notes and, combined with the warrants, effectively raise the price at which economic dilution would occur from the initial conversion price of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$79.89
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$97.12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share. For purposes of the computation of diluted earnings per share in accordance with GAAP, dilution will occur when the average share price of our common stock for a given period exceeds the conversion price of the Convertible Notes, which initially is equal to approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$79.89
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share. The convertible note hedge transactions and warrant transactions are discussed separately below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:60PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Convertible Note Hedge Transactions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. In connection with the issuance of the Convertible Notes, the Company entered into convertible note hedge transactions whereby the Company has call options to purchase a total of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock, which is the number of shares initially issuable upon conversion of the Convertible Notes in full, at a price of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$79.89
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which corresponds to the initial conversion price of the Convertible Notes, subject to customary anti-dilution adjustments substantially similar to those in the Convertible Notes. The convertible note hedge transactions are exercisable upon conversion of the Convertible Notes and will expire in 2019 if not earlier exercised. We paid an aggregate amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$42.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the convertible note hedge transactions, which was recorded as additional paid-in capital on the consolidated balance sheets. The convertible note hedge transactions are separate transactions and are not part of the terms of the Convertible Notes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:60PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Warrants.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the issuance of the Convertible Notes, the Company sold warrants whereby the holders of the warrants have the option to purchase a total of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at a strike price of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$97.12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The warrants will expire incrementally on 100 different dates from January&#160;6, 2020 to May&#160;28, 2020 and are exercisable at each such expiry date. If the average market value per share of our common stock for the reporting period exceeds the strike price of the warrants, the warrants will have a dilutive effect on our earnings per share. We received aggregate proceeds of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$23.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from the sale of the warrants, which was recorded as additional paid-in capital on the consolidated balance sheets. The warrants are separate transactions and are not part of the terms of the Convertible Notes or the convertible note hedge transactions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company recorded an initial deferred tax liability of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$15.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in connection with the debt discount associated with the Convertible Notes and recorded an initial deferred tax asset of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$16.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in connection with the convertible note hedge transactions. The deferred tax liability and deferred tax asset are included in non-current deferred tax liabilities on the consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Senior Secured Credit Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year senior secured revolving credit facility, subject to the terms of a Second Amended and Restated Credit Agreement dated as of March 31, 2015 (the "Amended Credit Agreement"), that becomes due and payable in full upon maturity on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	March&#160;31, 2020
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Amended Credit Agreement provides the option to increase the revolving credit facility or establish term loan facilities in an aggregate amount of up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, subject to customary conditions and the approval of any lender whose commitment would be increased, resulting in a maximum available principal amount under the Amended Credit Agreement of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$600 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The initial borrowings under the Amended Credit Agreement were used to refinance borrowings outstanding under a prior credit agreement, and future borrowings under the Amended Credit Agreement may be used for working capital, capital expenditures, acquisitions of businesses, share repurchases, and general corporate purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Fees and interest on borrowings vary based on our Consolidated Leverage Ratio (as defined in the Amended Credit Agreement). At our option, borrowings under the Amended Credit Agreement will bear interest at one, two, three or six-month LIBOR or an alternate base rate, in each case plus the applicable margin. The applicable margin will fluctuate between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;per annum and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;per annum, in the case of LIBOR borrowings, or between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;per annum and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;per annum, in the case of base rate loans, based upon our Consolidated Leverage Ratio at such time.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	23

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	HURON CONSULTING GROUP INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Tabular amounts in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Amounts borrowed under the Amended Credit Agreement may be prepaid at any time without premium or penalty. We are required to prepay the amounts outstanding under the Amended Credit Agreement in certain circumstances, including a requirement to pay all amounts outstanding under the Amended Credit Agreement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	90
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;days prior to the Convertible Indebtedness Maturity Date (as defined in the Amended Credit Agreement) unless (1) the Convertible Indebtedness Maturity Date is waived or extended to a later date, (2) the Company can demonstrate (a)&#160;Liquidity (as defined in the Amended Credit Agreement) in an amount at least equal to the principal amount due on the Convertible Indebtedness Maturity Date, and (b)&#160;financial covenant compliance after giving effect to such payments and any additional indebtedness incurred on a pro forma basis, or (3) this requirement is waived by the Required Lenders (as defined in the Amended Credit Agreement). In addition, we have the right to permanently reduce or terminate the unused portion of the commitments provided under the Amended Credit Agreement at any time.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The loans and obligations under the Amended Credit Agreement are secured pursuant to a Second Amended and Restated Security Agreement and a Second Amended and Restated Pledge Agreement (the &#8220;Pledge Agreement&#8221;) with Bank of America, N.A. as collateral agent, pursuant to which the Company and the subsidiary guarantors grant Bank of America, N.A., for the ratable benefit of the lenders under the Amended Credit Agreement, a first-priority lien, subject to permitted liens, on substantially all of the personal property assets of the Company and the subsidiary guarantors, and a pledge of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the stock or other equity interests in all domestic subsidiaries and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	65%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the stock or other equity interests in each &#8220;material first-tier foreign subsidiary&#8221; (as defined in the Pledge Agreement).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Amended Credit Agreement contains usual and customary representations and warranties; affirmative and negative covenants, which include limitations on liens, investments, additional indebtedness, and restricted payments; and two quarterly financial covenants as follows: (i)&#160;a maximum Consolidated Leverage Ratio (defined as the ratio of debt to consolidated EBITDA) of either
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to 1.00 or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to 1.00, depending on the measurement period, and (ii)&#160;a minimum Consolidated Interest Coverage Ratio (defined as the ratio of consolidated EBITDA to interest) of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to 1.00. Consolidated EBITDA for purposes of the financial covenants is calculated on a continuing operations basis and includes adjustments to add back share-based compensation costs, certain non-cash restructuring charges, and pro forma historical EBITDA for businesses acquired. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we were in compliance with these financial covenants with a Consolidated Leverage Ratio of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.24
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to 1.00 and a Consolidated Interest Coverage Ratio of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	18.43
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to 1.00.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Borrowings outstanding under the Amended Credit Agreement at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$68.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. These borrowings carried a weighted average interest rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, including the effect of the interest rate swap described below in Note 11 &#8220;Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activity." Borrowings outstanding under the Amended Credit Agreement at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$92.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and carried a weighted average interest rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The borrowing capacity under the revolving credit facility is reduced by any outstanding borrowings under the revolving credit facility and outstanding letters of credit. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had outstanding letters of credit totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which are primarily used as security deposits for our office facilities. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the unused borrowing capacity under the revolving credit facility was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$427.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="HURN2016123110-K_HTM_S3A52FA1C681E5B8F8F6CFDC2A3AAB588">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	8. Capital Structure
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Preferred Stock
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We are authorized to issue up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of preferred stock. Our certificate of incorporation authorizes our board of directors, without any further stockholder action or approval, to issue these shares in one or more classes or series, to establish from time to time the number of shares to be included in each class or series, and to fix the rights, preferences and privileges of the shares of each wholly unissued class or series and any of its qualifications, limitations or restrictions. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, no such preferred stock has been approved or issued.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Common Stock
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We are authorized to issue up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	500,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock, par value
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$.01
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share. The holders of common stock are entitled to one vote for each share held of record on each matter submitted to a vote of stockholders. Subject to the rights and preferences of the holders of any series of preferred stock that may at the time be outstanding, holders of common stock are entitled to such dividends as our board of directors may declare. In the event of any liquidation, dissolution or winding-up of our affairs, after payment of all of our debts and liabilities and subject to the rights and preferences of the holders of any series of preferred stock that may at the time be outstanding, holders of common stock will be entitled to receive the distribution of any of our remaining assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	HURON CONSULTING GROUP INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Tabular amounts in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	9. Earnings Per Share
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Basic earnings per share excludes dilution and is computed by dividing net income by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding for the period, excluding unvested restricted common stock. Diluted earnings per share reflects the potential reduction in earnings per share that could occur if securities or other contracts to issue common stock were exercised or converted into common stock under the treasury stock method. Such securities or other contracts include unvested restricted stock awards, outstanding common stock options, convertible senior notes, and outstanding warrants, to the extent dilutive. Earnings per share under the basic and diluted computations are as follows:&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_29"></A>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6,279
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	See Note 7 &#8220;Financing Arrangements&#8221; for further information on the convertible senior notes and warrants related to the issuance of convertible notes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In February 2014, our board of directors authorized a share repurchase program permitting us to repurchase up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$50 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our common stock through February 28, 2015 (the &#8220;February 2014 Share Repurchase Program&#8221;). We completed the February 2014 Share Repurchase Program in October 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We currently have a share repurchase program, authorized by our board of directors, pursuant to which we may, from time to time, repurchase up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$125 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our common stock through October&#160;31, 2017 (the &#8220;Share Repurchase Program&#8221;). The amount and timing of the repurchases will be determined by management and will depend on a variety of factors, including the trading price of our common stock, general market and business conditions, and applicable legal requirements. In 2016, we repurchased and retired
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	982,192
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$55.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and in 2015, we repurchased and retired
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	583,880
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$34.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$35.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;remains available for share repurchases.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	HURON CONSULTING GROUP INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Tabular amounts in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	10. Restructuring Charges
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In 2016, we incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of pretax restructuring expense. This expense primarily consisted of the following charges:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Severance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- We incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$7.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of severance expense as a result of workforce reductions, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was related to certain practices within our Healthcare and Business Advisory segments to better align our resources with market demand and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was related to our corporate infrastructure as a result of our Huron Legal divestiture.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Office exit costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- We incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of office exit costs primarily related to our Washington, D.C. space that we vacated in the fourth quarter of 2014. During the third quarter of 2016, we entered into a sublease agreement and adjusted our Washington, D.C. lease accrual to reflect the terms specified in the sublease agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- We also incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of restructuring expense related to the wind down of our foreign consulting operations based in the Middle East and other exit costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;pretax restructuring charge,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was related to our Healthcare segment,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was related to our corporate operations, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was related to our Business Advisory segment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In 2015, we incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of pretax restructuring expense. This expense primarily consisted of the following charges:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Severance -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of severance expense as a result of workforce reductions to better align our resources with market demand.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Office exit costs -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of office exit costs primarily related to updated assumptions for the lease accrual of the Washington, D.C. space vacated in the fourth quarter of 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;pretax restructuring expense,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was related to our Healthcare segment,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was related to our All Other segment as we wound down our public sector consulting practice and our foreign consulting operations based in the Middle East, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was related to our corporate operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In 2014, we incurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of pretax restructuring expense. This expense primarily consisted of the following charges:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Office exit costs -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We incurred charges totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;related to the consolidation of office space in Washington, D.C., Chicago, and New York, and the closure of our office in San Diego. The charges primarily consisted of the accrual of remaining lease obligations at vacated spaces, net of estimated sublease income. The vacated locations in Chicago and New York were acquired as part of business acquisitions during 2013 and 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Accelerated depreciation -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of accelerated depreciation expense on leasehold improvements at our vacated offices discussed above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Contract termination costs -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In the fourth quarter of 2014, we paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the early termination of certain telecommunication contracts related to the vacated office space in San Diego.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	All of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;pretax restructuring expense incurred in 2014 was related to our corporate operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:60PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Additions for the years ended December 31, 2016 and 2015 include
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$13.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, related to discontinued operations. Refer to Note 3 "Discontinued Operations" for additional information on our discontinued operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:60PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Adjustments to office space reductions represents changes in sublease assumptions and reductions in our remaining lease obligations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our restructuring charge liability related to office space reductions of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;represented the present value of remaining lease payments, net of estimated sublease income, primarily for our vacated office spaces in Washington, D.C., Houston, and New York. This restructuring charge liability is included as a component of accrued expenses and deferred compensation and other liabilities. Of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;restructuring charge liability related to employee costs at December 31, 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is expected to be paid in 2017. The restructuring charge liability related to employee costs is included as a component of accrued payroll and related benefits and deferred compensation and other liabilities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="HURN2016123110-K_HTM_S5383DEBC77C255E98725F8515797946F">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	11. Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activity
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On December&#160;8, 2011, we entered into a forward amortizing interest rate swap agreement effective
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	February&#160;29, 2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	April&#160;14, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&#160;We entered into this derivative instrument to hedge against the interest rate risks of our variable-rate borrowings described in Note 7 &#8220;Financing Arrangements.&#8221; The swap had an initial notional amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$56.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and amortized throughout the term. Under the terms of the interest rate swap agreement, we received from the counterparty interest on the notional amount based on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-month LIBOR and we paid to the counterparty a fixed rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.9875%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On May&#160;30, 2012, we entered into an amortizing interest rate swap agreement effective
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	May&#160;31, 2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which also ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	April&#160;14, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We entered into this derivative instrument to further hedge against the interest rate risks of our variable-rate borrowings. The swap had an initial notional amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$37.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and amortized throughout the term. Under the terms of the interest rate swap agreement, we received from the counterparty interest on the notional amount based on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-month LIBOR and we paid to the counterparty a fixed rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.70%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On April&#160;4, 2013, we entered into a forward amortizing interest rate swap agreement effective
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	March&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and ending
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	August&#160;31, 2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We entered into this derivative instrument to further hedge against the interest rate risks of our variable-rate borrowings. The swap had an initial notional amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$60.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and amortized quarterly until April 2016. Upon expiration of the two interest rate swaps in April 2016 described above, the notional amount of this interest rate swap increased to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$86.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and continues to amortize quarterly throughout the remaining term. Under the terms of the interest rate swap agreement, we receive from the counterparty interest on the notional amount based on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-month LIBOR and we pay to the counterparty a fixed rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.985%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We recognize all derivative instruments as either assets or liabilities at fair value on the balance sheet. We have designated these derivative instruments as cash flow hedges. Therefore, changes in the fair value of the derivative instruments are recorded as a component of other comprehensive income (&#8220;OCI&#8221;) to the extent of effectiveness and reclassified into interest expense upon settlement. The ineffective portion of the change in fair value of the derivative instruments is recognized in interest expense. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, it was anticipated that all of
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	27
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

</FONT>

</EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	All of the Company&#8217;s derivative instruments are transacted under the International Swaps and Derivatives Association (ISDA) master agreements. These agreements permit the net settlement of amounts owed in the event of default and certain other termination events. Although netting is permitted, it is the Company&#8217;s policy to record all derivative assets and liabilities on a gross basis on our consolidated balance sheet. All of the Company&#8217;s derivative instruments as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were held with the same counterparty.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We do not use derivative instruments for trading or other speculative purposes. Refer to Note 13 &#8220;Other Comprehensive Income (Loss)&#8221; for additional information on our derivative instruments.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:10PT;" HREF="#HURN2016123110-K_HTM_S42B1F11A3BAC561DA7E5A3C09D5506F0">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
